fsm_config.description: FSM modeling user interactions in a stack visualization with Push, Pop, and Peek operations, including visual feedback and messaging.
fsm_config.notes: Initial state is idle. PUSH_CLICK_VALID occurs when the input field contains a non-empty trimmed value; PUSH_CLICK_EMPTY when it is empty. POP_CLICK_NON_EMPTY/EMPTY and PEEK_CLICK_NON_EMPTY/EMPTY are determined by stack length > 0. Pushing and popping perform synchronous DOM updates and immediately transition back to idle via PUSH_COMPLETED/POP_COMPLETED. Peek visual feedback appends a highlighted top item and removes it after 1 second via PEEK_HIGHLIGHT_TIMEOUT, transitioning back to idle; REMOVE_HIGHLIGHT corresponds to the setTimeout removal. Empty feedback sets the message 'Stack is empty!' synchronously and returns to idle (EMPTY_MESSAGE_SHOWN). Buttons remain interactive in all states; no disabling occurs. CSS transitions are present on stack items but do not introduce additional asynchronous states in the code.
